Key Match Events: Christian Bethancourt had three hits and seven RBIs, with six in the final three innings, including a bases-loaded single with two outs in the ninth to give the Cubs an 11-10 lead.
Bethancourt ripped a two-run homer in the seventh to cut the deficit to five runs, and in the eighth, he pulled a double down the left-field line to drive in two more.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cubs were trying to find a way to get back into the wild-card race, and with a pair of blowouts in the first two games, they were able to rest their best relievers for much of the Pirates series.
Post-Match Reflections: Craig Counsell said it was a lot of fun and a heck of a job by everybody, staying in the fight and not giving in. He also praised Christian Bethancourt's performance, saying he's been unbelievable since coming up from the minors.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs scored 41 runs in a three-game series, which is impressive, especially against three very good starters. They also hope to continue this momentum and take it to D.C. and then to the homestand.
Others: Christian Bethancourt was activated on July 26, and since then, the Cubs have gone 19-10, and he's been performing brilliantly, with 11 hits, seven for extra bases, and a.407/.448/.889 slash line with 15 RBIs.
